content:
Apple Inc. Q3 2024 Earnings Call Transcript

Operator: Good afternoon. Welcome to the Apple Q3 Fiscal Year 2024 Earnings Conference Call. Today's call is being recorded.

I would now like to turn the call over to Suhasini Chandramouli, Vice President of Investor Relations. Please go ahead.

Suhasini Chandramouli: Thank you. Good afternoon, everyone. Speaking first today is Apple CEO Tim Cook, and he'll be followed by CFO Luca Maestri. After that, we'll open the call to questions.

Tim Cook, CEO: Thank you, Suhasini. Good afternoon, everyone, and thanks for joining the call today.

We are pleased to report another strong quarter. Revenue for the June quarter was $85.8 billion, up 5 percent year over year. This was driven by an all-time revenue record in Services and strong performance in several of our product categories.

Our installed base of active devices reached a new all-time high across all products and all geographic segments. We set a June quarter record in Greater China and saw very strong double-digit growth in several other markets.

We generated nearly $29 billion in operating cash flow during the quarter and returned over $32 billion to shareholders. We continue to invest meaningfully in innovation across the business.

Let me now turn to our product performance. iPhone revenue came in at $39.3 billion for the quarter. We continue to see strong demand for iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max.

Mac revenue was $7.0 billion, up 2 percent year over year. iPad revenue was $7.2 billion, up 24 percent year over year, driven by the launch of the new iPad Pro and iPad Air.

Wearables, Home, and Accessories revenue was $8.1 billion. Services revenue reached an all-time record of $24.2 billion, up 14 percent year over year. We now have over 1 billion paid subscriptions across our platform.

Now I'll hand it over to Luca for more details on our financial performance.

Luca Maestri, CFO: Thank you, Tim. Good afternoon, everyone.

As Tim mentioned, total revenue for the quarter was $85.8 billion, an increase of 5 percent year over year. Gross margin was 46.3 percent, up 100 basis points from a year ago. We continue to focus on both costs and mix to deliver these strong margins.

Operating expenses were $14.3 billion, up about 7 percent year over year. This reflects our continued investment in innovation, including our work on Apple Intelligence.

Our operating income was $26.2 billion, representing an operating margin of 30.5 percent.

Earnings per diluted share were $1.40, up 11 percent year over year.

We generated $24.1 billion in operating cash flow during the quarter. Free cash flow was $20.3 billion. We returned over $32 billion to shareholders, including $3.8 billion in dividends and approximately $26 billion in share repurchases.

Our net cash position was approximately minus $60 billion, and we continue to move toward our target of a net cash neutral position over time.

R&D expenses were $7.2 billion. SG&A expenses were $6.0 billion. Our effective tax rate was 11.2 percent.

Net income for the quarter was $21.4 billion.

We ended the quarter with $162 billion in cash plus marketable securities. Total debt was $108 billion.

For the September quarter, we expect year-over-year revenue growth to be similar to the June quarter.

With that, let's open the call up for questions.

Analyst: Thank you. Can you talk about the Services growth trajectory and how you see it trending?

Tim Cook, CEO: Services continues to be an incredible growth driver. As I mentioned, we hit $24.2 billion in the quarter, up 14 percent. We are very bullish on the long-term trajectory.
